channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Planet Earth
channel.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's great plains. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Great British Seaside Holiday
channel.desc: A bank holiday celebration of the history of the British seaside holiday experience.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Tribe
channel.desc: The Darhad herders of Mongolia are some of the last nomadic people on the planet. Explorer Bruce Parry joins a family for their arduous winter migration.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Planet Earth
channel.desc: David Attenborough's natural history series. This episode looks at the tropical rainforests, which are home to a staggering 50 per cent of the world's species.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Some Like It Hot
channel.desc: Comic masterpiece from Billy Wilder. Musicians Joe and Jerry accidentally witness the St Valentine's Day massacre and attempt to make a getaway by joining an all-girl jazz band.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Life and Death of Peter Sellers
channel.desc: Film about Peter Sellers's rise from radio star to one of the world's top comic actors. Contains strong language and some scenes of a sexual nature.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Citizen Kane
channel.desc: A landmark in the history of cinema, telling the story of newspaper magnate Charles Foster Kane in a series of flashbacks. Starring Orson Welles.

channel.desc: Discover the maverick behind some of the most iconic images of the past century.

channel.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens

channel.title: How to Build a Cathedral

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Cornwall's Red River

channel.title: Planet Earth
channel.desc: Documentary series which celebrates our planet in all its glory. David Attenborough reveals the greatest woodlands on earth, from the northern Taiga to Madagascar.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Last Battle of the Vikings
channel.desc: Documentary. Marine archaeologist Dr Jon Henderson tells the story of the Norsemen in Scotland, visiting archaeological sites across Scotland and Norway.
